pullRequest.body:
I simply went for similarities: maybe some of these merges are actually different authors with very similar names!

Suggested by the list in [this Zulip message](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/copyright.20header.20line.20lint/near/454640469).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fca3d6ee6f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15256/commits/fca3d6ee6f2c7dd95c1580c23eefbc2d0ca4aef9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! 游냋
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
@adomani can you request a review from anyone whose name you changed that hasn't already approved the PR? I'm not saying we necessarily need approval from literally everyone, but the more the better.
I have lost my hats and dashes  "Tom치코 Sk콏ivan". Likely I'm not consistent about it but I would prefer the version with hats and dashes.

> I have lost my hats and dashes "Tom치코 Sk콏ivan". Likely I'm not consistent about it but I would prefer the version with hats and dashes.

I simply made the replacement looking at the most frequent spelling that was used.  In your case, 9 were Tomas Skrivan and 5 were Tom치코 Sk콏ivan.

Anyway, I changed them all to Tom치코 Sk콏ivan!

This PR has been open for about 2 weeks.

I think that everyone who wanted to object to how their name is spelled probably already commented, so I removed the `awaiting-author`s label!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10342215537/job/28624884073)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10342215537/job/28624884032)
lgtm. Please maintainer merge on my behalf
lgtm. Please maintainer merge on my behalf

```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2022 Ian Benway. All rights reserved.
```

```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2022 Ian Benway. All rights reserved.
```
That's funny. Why am I the author but not the copyright holder?
I'm not sure: maybe a weird previous split?
游뱡
See leanprover-community/mathlib#17350

BTW, @YaelDillies am I right that the only lemma in this file doesn't need a (semi)field structure, only a linear ordered additive commutative group with dense order? If yes, could you please generalize it and move the file elsewhere?
You are absolutely right: #15327. Not sure where to move the lemma though

```suggestion
Authors: Kyle Miller
```
I am not sure how I (alone!) ended up here but it was probably due to my general confusion.
I think the name might not be the only issue here...
Yury is a pioneer of formalization.
This is indeed my file and that is indeed my full name, thanks!

```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2021 Yury Kudryashov. All rights reserved.
```
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/6395

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: uniformize some author names
